intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. poecilodermum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are shorter than the central disk florets, and it produces small, oval seeds in a capsule. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
